result.execSummary:
The defendant John S. Isham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence IMPOSED & STAYED; 9 months in the county jail w/huber; credit 1 day;

Probation 1 year; 4 months county jail beginning 12-26-2014 at 3:00pm; work release; credit for 1 day; AODA treatment and follow-thru (12-12-2014); absolute sobriety/no alcohol/drug use without a valid Rx.; congnitive thinking; fine/costs totaling $1083.00;  Bail money to be forwarded to DOC; report to probation today;

miscConds.notes: $883.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$200.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Cognitive Group Intervention Program - Critical Thinking Program,
Absolute Sobriety; No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages;  No drug use without a valid prescription.
AODA assessment  within 45 days (12-12-2014) and follow-through with recommendations

timeConds.notes: 4 months county jail beginning 12-26-14 at 3:00pm; work release; credit for 1 day/

Defendant John S. Isham in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce R. Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to amend Ct. 1 to 346.04 (2t) Failure to obey officer signal.  Court grants motion to amend.  Advised of rights; joint recommendation; parties stipulate to facts; Defendant pleads NC to the Amended Ct. 1; court finds guilty and convicts on Amended Ct. 1; Sentence IMPOSED & STAYED; 9 months in the county jail w/huber; credit 1 day; Probation 1 year; 4 months county jail beginning 12-26-2014 at 3:00pm; work release; credit for 1 day; AODA treatment and follow-thru (12-12-2014); absolute sobriety/no alcohol/drug use without a valid Rx.; congnitive thinking; fine/costs totaling $1083.00;  Bail money to be forwarded to DOC; report to probation today; plea questionnaire filed.
Defendant John S. Isham in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce R. Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant John S. Isham in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury Trial requested.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant John S. Isham in court with Attorney Martin Jarvis.  John M Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing waived by D.  Court found probable cause.  D acknowledges receipt of information and waives the reading of the information.  Court grants 30 days to file motions, change of venues and substitution of judges.  Court entered a not guilty plea on behalf of D to Count 1.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant John S. Isham in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce R Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. request prelim,  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant John S. Isham in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce R. Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Acknowledges receipt of complaint; waives reading of complaint; advised of rights/penalties; advised of right to prelim; waives time limits for prelim - reserves right; bond continues.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.
DE appeared in court in custody by video. Court finds probable cause. Court set $1000 cash bond. Reset court date to 03-18-14 at 8:30 AM.
